subject: Learning
title: Theory of Mind: Understanding Others
description: A fast breakdown of Theory of Mind: Understanding Others for builders.

hook.text: A three-year-old sees you hide chocolate in a drawer. Someone moves it. They think you'll look in the new spot.

buildup.text: Theory of mind is the ability to understand that others have beliefs, desires, and knowledge different from your own.

discovery.text: It typically develops around age 4â€“5, as shown by the classic 'false belief' test.

twist.text: Before theory of mind develops, children literally cannot conceive that someone knows something different from them.

climax.text: Theory of mind is the foundation for empathy, deception, persuasion, and all complex social interaction.

punchline.text: Understanding that others think differently is where social intelligence begins.

quiz.question: What is theory of mind?
options: The ability to understand that others have different beliefs and knowledge from your own
A scientific theory about how the mind works
The ability to read other people's thoughts telepathically
